comments.text:
Reading the RFC Access-Control-Allow-Origin I see that there are several options for wildcards.

http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-access-control-20080214/#access-item

It appears that only "http://www.domain.com" and "*" are implemented currently? According to the MDN none of the wildcard options are implemented (yet)?

https://developer.mozilla.org/en/http_access_control

It would be very helpful to have *.domain.com implemented, as right now your options are the exact domain, or everyone is allowed.

comments.raw_text:
The specification was updated. The value of Access-Control-Allow-Origin is defined to be the value of the Origin field as sent in the request, a "*" for allowing all or the string "null" to deny all. [1]

This bug is now invalid and should be closed.

[1] http://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-cors-20140116/#access-control-allow-origin-response-header
